subclusters.subcluster_name: Replicative and Telomere-Associated Cellular Senescence Theory
Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and p16Ink4a Cellular Senescence Theory
Senescent Microglia and Neuroinflammation Cellular Senescence Theory
Endothelial Cell Senescence and Vascular Dysfunction Cellular Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Telomere-Associated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on replicative senescence linked to telomere length and its impact on vascular aging and cardiovascular disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and p16Ink4a Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes accumulation of p16Ink4a-positive senescent cells and their SASP-driven contribution to aging and age-related disorders.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence via Caveolin-1 and p53 Pathways
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative stress-induced premature senescence mediated by caveolin-1 and p53/p21 signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and p16Ink4a Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights accumulation of senescent cells with SASP effects and their causal role in aging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Telomere-Associated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on multiple genetic pathways inducing senescence, especially telomerase repression and telomere shortening.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on oxidative DNA damage accumulation from ROS leading to mitochondrial dysfunction and senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and p16Ink4a Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes stable cell cycle arrest and SASP secretion driving tissue dysfunction and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Microglia and Neuroinflammation Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on microglial senescence, metabolic reprogramming, and SASP-driven neuroinflammation in brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Microglia and Neuroinflammation Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence in post-mitotic neurons and glia with SASP contributing to neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Microglia and Neuroinflammation Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details microglial senescence impairing clearance of beta-amyloid and promoting Alzheimer's disease pathology.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Endothelial Cell Senescence and Vascular Dysfunction Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence in brain endothelial cells disrupting blood-brain barrier and promoting neurovascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Telomere-Associated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes two-stage mortality model of senescence involving cell cycle arrest and crisis linked to replicative limits.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Lamin A Defect-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on protease inhibitor-induced lamin A processing defects causing reversible p53-dependent senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Telomere-Associated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details telomere shortening triggering DNA damage checkpoints and replicative senescence conserved across species.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extracellular Proteolysis-Regulated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes PAI-1 regulation of extracellular proteolysis and its role in senescence messaging and systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53-Dependent DNA Damage and Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes p53 activation by DNA damage (Brca1 deficiency) inducing senescence that drives aging and tumor suppression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Cellular Senescence Interaction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in autophagy contributing to accumulation of damaged components and senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and p16Ink4a Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial dysfunction, DNA damage, apoptosis resistance, and SASP in senescent cells driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence in Neuropsychiatric Disorders and Brain Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links cellular senescence driven by AhR activation and ferrosenescence to premature brain aging in schizophrenia.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Endothelial Cell Senescence and Vascular Dysfunction Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes endothelial senescence contributing to pulmonary arterial hypertension via SASP and vascular remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Microglia and Neuroinflammation Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent glial cells driving neuroinflammation, cognitive decline, and benefits of senolytic therapy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Telomere-Associated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details telomere shortening-induced senescence impairing vascular cell function and angiogenesis in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Programming of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genetic control of senescence phenotype and recessive mutations enabling immortalization.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Induced Cellular Plasticity and Carcinogenesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence-driven epigenetic changes and inflammation promoting epithelial plasticity and cancer progression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Cell Senescence and Immune Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on replicative senescence of T cells due to thymic involution and homeostatic proliferation causing immune decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Microglia and Neuroinflammation Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links microglial senescence to impaired pathogen clearance, beta-amyloid accumulation, and Alzheimer's disease pathology.
